review.itemreviewed: Titanal Tour Pro 2 Ski Touring Poles
review.reviewBody:
Basket came off.
There are no replacement baskets available.
I want my money back.
review.name: Garbage
comment: Hi, we are so sorry to hear about the baskets. We have sent an e-mail to you to try and get this resolved.

review.itemreviewed: Titanal Tour Pro 2 Ski Touring Poles
review.reviewBody:
Same as everyone else. The baskets fall off and Backcountry doesn't have replacements. It will take serious modification to make these poles work. 

Do not buy them.
review.name: Stop selling these to people.

review.itemreviewed: Titanal Tour Pro 2 Ski Touring Poles
review.reviewBody: Should have read reviews before purchase, but the price was too enticing. Both baskets fell off within a couple days, and they are not standard baskets that can be replaced with generics. I am a fan of backcountry gear, but will think twice about purchasing their branded gear after this one. Poles are in the dumpâ€¦
review.name: Junk

review.itemreviewed: Titanal Tour Pro 2 Ski Touring Poles
review.reviewBody: Just like others that purchased these poles the materials, design and quality of them functions great. The pole baskets are main issue with these. On my second outing with these one of my pole baskets broke off and now I am purchasing replacement pole baskets so I can use this product and paying 3x the cost of the items on shipping..
review.name: Great Poles... Need some more thought.

review.itemreviewed: Titanal Tour Pro 2 Ski Touring Poles
Titanal Tour Pro 2 Ski Touring Poles
review.reviewBody: These were my favorite poles. then I lost my first basket. Seemed like maybe that was okay as I was skiing through lots of manzanita and brush that could have caught it. Then I lost my second. Raiiling a groomer. At least I found that one.
review.name: Great plan poor execution

review.itemreviewed: Titanal Tour Pro 2 Ski Touring Poles
review.reviewBody:
Broke after one day of skiing powder. Stayed intact when skiing groomers, but breaks off the minute you're in deep snow.

Seems others have same issue. Please fix.
review.name: Basket broke

review.itemreviewed: Titanal Tour Pro 2 Ski Touring Poles
review.reviewBody: Overall the design of the poles is okay, decent size foam grip and the lock mechanism works. However, the basket design is flawed and broke on the first day I skied with them. I would reccomend choosing a differnt pair of poles.
review.name: Basket broke on the first day

name: Titanal Tour Pro 2 Ski Touring Poles

description: Buy the Stoic Tech Hoodie - Past Season - Women's online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Tech Hoodie - Past Season - Women's
hasVariant.description: Buy the Stoic Tech Hoodie - Past Season - Women's online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: The description did not mention that I was purchasing a used shirt!
review.name: Shirt was used

review.reviewBody:
Have used this hoodie as a base layer while doing non-technical mountaineering in winter (temps were pretty warm though), but haven't tried it during summer yet. 

Hoodie fits well, and isn't too transparent depending on what's worn underneath. The fit is great for me, and I am someone who has a long torso and long arms, and the sleeve's length is perfect. The material is soft and very comfortable to wear. I'll probably use this for rock climbing as well, as it feels like there's enough stretch in it.
review.name: Love it!

review.reviewBody: I love this sunshirt. I have broad shoulders and often have issues with sleeves being too short and shirts like this being too boxy. I have an athletic frame and this hoody fits so well! The fabric is soft and lightweight. Definitely my go too sun hoody for any activity from trail running to biking to time on the water.
review.name: Loved this sunshirt

review.reviewBody: Love this hoodie for climbing, biking, hiking, and hanging. Fits great, super comfy, fun colors.
review.name: Will Wear Everyday

review.reviewBody: This appears to be a pretty basic sun hoodie, but it's deceivingly soft, stretchy, and breathable. I'm wary about the breathability of a lot of sun shirts, but this one performed quite well on a hot sunny day climbing in the southern UT desert. I've never been one for crazy patterns and colors, so I'm a big fan of the muted earth tone colors that this hoodie comes in. Perfect length, fit, and feel!
review.name: An Essential
comment: Is black actually black? The photo looks grey.

name: Tech Hoodie - Past Season - Women's

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I weigh about 168 and usually depending on brand between a small and a medium, and the medium in this fit perfectly as in not skin tight, but not too loose just right. I'm a 38 for my chest.
review.name: Great fit and feel.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The fit fabrics and color are exemplary. These garments never disappoint! I appreciate that the price includes shipping.
review.name: Always just right

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Product is ok. It does keep you warm but not the same after washing and air drying it.
review.name: Wouldn't buy again

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The neck hole seems a little large but otherwise it's perfect!
review.name: So good I should get another

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] We just moved from Cali to Mich and bought a beautiful historic home... But it's drafty in our old home and our bodies aren't acclimated to "the seasons" yet so we wear these under our shirts pretty much all week and even when we go out! They wash in the washer nicely and they air dry quickly. They're wool so they don't get smelly. And even though they're wool, the shirts do not itch much (an occasional itch in the middle of the back but nothing bad all and honestly could be from the dryness). They fit well (and true) and layer under nicely. It really does warm us up! We're women but wanted the more relaxed fit of a mens shirt. We even bought the leggings for ourselves (got womens pants tho).
review.name: It's worth it - get it!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I use this product for everyday wear and occasionally use it for sleep. It is a superb garment well worth its price. I love the color olive! Fits perfectly.
review.name: Merino 200

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] My Son recommended this merino wool base layer based on his experience. I am pleased with the quality & workmanship except, for what ever the reason, the base layer that I received has a hard pressed crease along the top edge of both sleeve, I am returning it and plan to re-purchase another one.
review.name: Good Merino Wool Product

review.reviewBody: One of the best, most durable and versatile base layers out there--for the love of god please make a white or beige color. The colors currently offered are for an 8 year old.
review.name: Amazing base layer. Terrible colors.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I wore this shirt everyday for a week on an Alaska cruise. Kept me warm next to the glaciers. No smell so the bears did not chase me. Loved it - you will too
review.name: Best shirt ever !!!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I wear the top when the weather gets into the 60s and as a base layer when it's in the 50s. Work great for around the house or on the ski slopes. I'm 6' and trim build, a medium fits perfect.
review.name: My go to top.

name: 200 Oasis LS Crew Top - Men's

review.reviewBody: I bought these for this hunting season for all of the bush-whacking and dew in the early mornings. I wear a size 7 shoe and purchased a medium, they fit fine over my shoe but were a tad large in my calves. The reason I decided not to exchange was because theyâ€™ll fit well over snow pants or heavier bottom layers. 4/5 stars due to the sizing but not sure if a small would have been better. The gaiters withstood a lot of wear and tear within the first few days and still shed the water nicely as well as keep my legs warm/ dry.
review.name: Nice Gaiters

review.reviewBody: Excellent quality, they keep my lower legs and tops of my boots dry and clean. Very happy with my purchase
review.name: Excellent quality, they keep my

review.reviewBody: These are brilliant for walking in muddy conditions. They are so comfortable and I never have to adjust them. I wish I had bought them years ago! I bought a size medium and have size 5 feet and fairly well defined calves (not skinny!)
review.name: These are brilliant for walking

review.reviewBody: These fit well and work brilliantly as expected for Rab. However, I have been disappointed in the quality as had to return these twice due to them breaking after a few wears. One pair the button fell off, and the other pair there was a rip by the loop after 1 weekend trip. The plastic loop which goes underneath your boot is also not hardwearing and the plastic cracked revealing the fabric underneath. Had to refund as these are not reliable.
review.name: Work brilliantly but don't last

review.reviewBody: they fit perfectly and do their job as I hoped they would.
review.name: they fit perfectly and do

review.reviewBody: I usually only write positive reviews, but I was very disappointed in how long these lasted. I used them about half a dozen times climbing peaks this spring before both straps broke off. Prior to breaking, they did keep snow out and kept me dry.
review.name: Worked but broke easily

review.reviewBody: Bought these for my wife so she can use hiking boots throughout the winter instead of wellies. Really well made with plenty of adjustable parts so you can get the fit just right. So far. so good. Also worth mentioning that I was a little confused by the sizing ( as there was no "small" option on the Women's Gaiters). Used the chat bot on the Rab site and got an instant answer. Good service.
review.name: Bought these for my wife

name: Muztag GTX Gaiter - Women's

review.itemreviewed: Geotrecca Low RP Hiking Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: Very comfortable with full support I really like to wearing them. I walked 4 miles daily and the they do the job very well. Very good materials * The tongues of the shoes are a little short. I wish they were longer
review.name: I recommend this shoes

review.itemreviewed: Geotrecca Low RP Hiking Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: Green color is ugly, but I bought these shoes based on price (50% off!) and brand experience. I use them for exercise walking, not for daily wear. So the color was not important. Love the shoe so far (20+ miles).
review.name: Great Deal on a very comfortable shoe.

review.itemreviewed: Geotrecca Low RP Hiking Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: Well designed comfortable and attractive shoes Seems very good for all season walking hiking and everyday wear
review.name: Attractive hiking shoes

review.itemreviewed: Geotrecca Low RP Hiking Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: This shoe sits very high, not a low or zero drop feel. The tongue is extremely stiff and can dig into front of your ankle. On sale it was worth it....full price maybe not.
review.name: Not a Low shoe but sturdy

review.itemreviewed: Geotrecca Low RP Hiking Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: I was planning footware for a trip around the British Isles in April and May, 2024 - typically fine urban walking and trail hiking weather with an almost assuredly of "liquid sunshine" on a regular basis. I came to Teva seeking waterproof walking shoes. I found them in the excellent Geotrecca Low, bought them a couple weeks early to wear around on local walks and shopping and then confidently packed them for my trip. This first pair was the grey tone color. I liked them so much I ordered a green/brown tone pair even before the trip because I did not want to risk them being unavailable a month later. I am quite satisfied with this footware. The soles grip well on every surface, including wet cobblestone medieval streets. The waterproof attribute is verified; never wet socks inside the shoes. Support is very good and they were comfortable even after long days out adventuring through villages, cities and parklands. I took a picture of them after about a month, but cannot find a way to upload it . . . a measure of my high satisfaction and sincere recommendation.
review.name: I Even Bought a Second Pair in the Other Color

review.itemreviewed: Geotrecca Low RP Hiking Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: I searched for Waterproof shoe/boots to walk around cities of Great Britain and then future travel plans. These looked a good choice but so far have just been breaking them in. The inside footbed feels a bit stiff -- not cushioned like foam bedded lifestyle shoes -- but of course that might be most desirable as I spend hours on uneven, old, stone pavements. The soles are very grippy, even on wet, smooth surfaces. The tread is not super aggressive like a true trail shoe/boot should be -- and this is what I wanted for more urban walking. I appreciate the "rock" as my foot rotates from heel to toe: allows a comfortable walking gait. The tongue design does not allow water to wash up around to the top of the shoe and drain into the inside -- a major plus for Ireland puddles. I normally wear a size 12 in Teva products and this sizing did not disappoint; the toe box is roomy enough to allow wearing mid-weight socks. I am very optimistic and will pack them for the trip. If all goes well on this first trip wearing them, I hope to return to this review and increase the rating to five (5) stars.
review.name: WP Walking Shoes for a Great Britain Adventure

review.itemreviewed: Geotrecca Low RP Hiking Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: Comfortable shoe, but run wide. I weak a medium weight hiking sock with them and still really have to cinch up the laces very tightly. My feet still move around considerably in the shoes.
review.name: Good Shoe

name: Geotrecca Low RP Hiking Shoe - Men's

review.reviewBody:
I recently purchased the Wharf Beanie with the Cotopaxi patch, and it has quickly become my go-to accessory for chilly weather. The material feels soft against my skin, and the fit is snug without being too tight, providing just the right amount of warmth for outdoor activities.

I love the vibrant Cotopaxi patchâ€”itâ€™s a fun way to show off the brand while adding a pop of color. Whether I'm out for a morning run, hiking, or just running errands, the beanie stays put and keeps me comfortable. The craftsmanship feels durable, so I anticipate it holding up well over time.

Highly recommend this beanie for anyone looking for a versatile, high-quality addition to their outdoor gear collection. Thank you, Cotopaxi, for another stellar product!

review.itemreviewed: Splash A Little II Jacket - Women's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Love my new rain jacket! It can still be challenging at times to find clothing/jackets that are long enough in the body & sleeve length for being a tall woman. This jacket not only fits perfectly but length in arms & body are wonderful. I also love that itâ€™s very stylish! I hope for myself & other tall women that you will always have a large selection in clothing for us! Just because we re talk doesnâ€™t mean that we donâ€™t want to look stylish no matter our age. People notice us because we stand out, might as well look good no matter what!

The arm length is good, the length of the jacket falls at my hips. The hood fits well if my hair is down or in a low braid. If my hair is in a bun it wonâ€™t cover my head (to be expected). Great quality jacket, love it!

review.reviewBody:
The product description says black, the tag on them when they arrived said black, but these were definitely dark blue and not black. Not a great look with all the black bibs I own, but didn't seem worth the effort to return them--even though they're a lot for what they are...

They fit fine without too much slipping if you pull them up nice and high, but past 20 miles the material started to bunch on the back of my knee. I'm also not sure why these have two relatively uncomfortable seams instead of one, but they do. 

It seems like this is a cycling accessory that should be easy for brands to get right, but no one really does.
review.name: Is Blue the New Black?

review.reviewBody: I found these true to size. However the band around the top is so thin it rolls up and feels like a tourniquet cutting into my thighs, but at least they don't slide down. Also because the material is so slick my shorts slide up. However it does keep the sun off and my legs don't feel overheated. I've ridden up to 85Â° now but I don't think I could wear them in any warmer weather. The jury is still out on whether I will continue to wear them.
review.name: Keeps the sun off but uncomfortable

review.reviewBody: Somehow, an XS is still a little large on my legs.  I have relatively thin, but muscular legs, so I always have problems finding knee and leg warmers that don't look baggy on me.  This XS fits well enough, all considering.  The leg gripper works well and stayed up for my 50-mile gravel ride.  It's nice to have a super-thin knee warmer to just take the edge off a slightly chilly day.  I'll definitely be using these in the fall and spring!
review.name: Why don't these come in XXS?  LOL!

name: Sun Knee Sleeve

description: Buy the Joolca GottaGo Toilet online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: GottaGo Toilet
hasVariant.description: Buy the Joolca GottaGo Toilet online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
Just spent a week boondocking in the High Sierras in the middle of winter and used my GottaGo toilet exclusively. Let's be real, there is no solution that compares to flushing your toilet at home. I originally used a Thedford cassette toilet and really hated emptying it. The GottaGo toilet solves all that. The design works, separating #1 from #2 makes emptying both containers more &quot;palatable&quot;. At least you don't have to see the #2 again. Just twist and knot the bag then throw it in the trash and you're done. 

 Best part is it doesn't smell like my cassette toilet used to. Closest thing to my bathroom at home.
review.name: Best solution for your waste

review.reviewBody: Saw your toilet on U-Tube, It had been given great reviews. I like the separation feature. I'm getting one today.
review.name: Worked good for the people on U-Tube.

review.reviewBody: Great toilet, perfect size and form factor. Lightyears ahead of the competition. Avoid Mexican night if you are planning to use this, possibly could be a problem.
review.name: Best Joolca product yet

review.reviewBody: I have been waiting for a product like this to hit the market, and of course, Joolca is the one to make it happen! Such an ingenious company that always takes my dream products and makes them into reality. Bravo!
review.name: You have to admit, this is perfect.

name: GottaGo Toilet

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This little kit has it all. It has everything I need for a minor cut or burn. It fits perfectly in my glove box or purse. Cute little tin too. The products inside are of decent quality.
review.name: Handy

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This is your typical first aid kit . It's got everything you would normally find in a first aid kit , it's the perfect size to keep in your purse for emergencies .
review.name: good for emergencies

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This is a super cute forst aid kit to keep in your purse or pocket. Itâ€™s slim and has everything you need for small cuts and scrapes and it wonâ€™t get ruined by water or anything with the metal container holding everything together.
review.name: Super cute

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I didn't realize how much I needed a first aid kit until I bought this. I had broke a cup earlier that day and thought I had swept all the glass up. Turns out I didn't, I got a piece of glass stuck in my foot and thats when this first aid kit came in to help. It had tweezers to pick it out, alcohol swabs, antibacterial suave and bandages. I now carry this thing everywhere with me. It is the perfect size for on the go.
review.name: Wonders

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I always wanted a first aid kit that had the basics and was compact. This kit met all my needs. It is light, easy to carry, contains the basics I need and the packaging is perfect. Super recommend!
review.name: Perfect!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I love this small medical kit! I have it in my car and itâ€™s very small but has enough for any small incidents. I love this and will probably be purchasing more for future reference.
review.name: Gravest basic kit for backpack or car!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] My wife often laughs at me for always having a readily available First Aid kit, until she needs me to use it to fix a boo-boo. I picked this one up to keep in my car, I had one in there, but it had been a while not to mention the plastic was a bit warped, so this metal tin should hold up better in the long-run.
review.name: Great for my car

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This product is so tiny and cute but comes with everything necessary in a first aid kit. I live in a place with lots of mountains which means lots of hiking, this product is so small but is perfect for those long trips in the woods especially since I'm accident prone.
review.name: It's so tiny and cute!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This is a nice, lightweight tin that contains such practical items you might need in a pinch! I love the though out content! My favorite item is the whistle, something you don't always think to bring! It also comes with first aid care, a few size bandages & butterfly strips, ointment, insect bite pads & alcohol wipes! Even a little tweezer for tick/splinter removal & safety pins! Something I wouldn't have thought of are the moleskin pieces for blisters - precut for convenience! Perfect First Aid kit for any hike or day out!
review.name: A small handy kit with everything you need!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This first aid kit is very handy. You can store this little kit almost anywhere. It comes with all of the necessary things that you will need for whatever reason. I love that I can carry it anywhere. I definitely recommend everyone to purchase a couple of these kits
review.name: Very handy

name: Compact Drying Towel Refill - 4-Pack

review.reviewBody: Nice, lightweight trail shoes! Perfect for hiking in warm or cool weather. Breathes nicely, forms to foot well. Good grip on the trail.
review.name: Lightweight Hiker

review.reviewBody: Overall, this is a good shoe. However, it runs small and narrow. I typically wear a size 14 wide, and while the shoe is comfortable, it feels a bit tight along the sides. That said, if you have narrow feet, this shoe would likely be a perfect fit for you.
review.name: Good overall performance

review.reviewBody: Best shoe Iâ€™ve ever purchased , light, comfortable, wide toe box, sharp looking !
review.name: Most comfortable shoe I own

review.reviewBody: Awesome soles. I always find most zero drop shoes try to have a minimalist sole, which leaves my feet tired
review.name: Great feel and very comfortable

review.reviewBody: Awesome casual walking shoe. Breathable, light. Do not expose to dirt or water.
review.name: Mall Walker

review.reviewBody: An amazing all-round river shoe! These shoes look sharp, grip well, and have just the right balance of flexibility in the boat and support for on the trail.
review.name: Just bought my second pair

review.reviewBody:
The TR1 Mesh is true to size and are a very comfortable shoe
 I matched mine with a pair of Cressi Ultra Stretch Neoprene Socks, 1.5mm, which kept my feet warm in Missouri's spring-fed Ozark Mountains streams. They kept every rock out. The one drawback to the shoes is they are sand magnates. Luckily, the neoprene socks kept the sand off my feet but i have to stoo fishing, wading and exploring long enough to dump out sand.
As long as you have gravel bottom streams or larger stones, you will love these shoes. I do want to mention when larger stones are covered in moss and super slippery, boots with metal cleats work better than these shoes.
review.name: TR1 Mesh, Missouri Ozark Streams review

review.reviewBody: Overall great shoes! My only complaint is the grip in a stream setting. For most applications there is plenty of grip, but if you were using them exclusively as a wading shoe for fishing it may not meet your expectations. Maybe not the intention of the design but it is what I bought them for. Overall a great buy.
review.name: Worth the buy

review.reviewBody: I purchased these for a trip to Hawaii.  I needed a pair of shoes that would cover a variety of activities.  Trips to town, light hiking, waterfall exploration, rocky beaches, zip lining, tubing... these shoes did it all.  They are light weight, they drain and dry quickly, and they pass as perfectly normal looking sneakers.  The grip is also great in wet and dry conditions.  The perfect shoes if you want to pack light like I do.
review.name: Great Buy

review.reviewBody:
I have looked for a decent canoe tripping shoe for my stupid wide feet for 40 years...this is by far the best option I have ever found!  The fit is great, the comfort is great, both wet and dry (mostly...see below), the grip on wet rocks, also great.  Good support and they even have laces that stay tied!

Not perfect though:
- My biggest complaint is that, when worn with bare feet (as I assume they're meant to be), I get sore spots developing on the little toe and heel of my left foot.  Now, that said, I have never had a water shoe that didn't wear a hole in my foot, and the TR1 Mesh performed better than others in this regard.  But still...
- They don't drain as well as I'd like.  I invariably wind up with a cup or two of water in the canoe every time I get in, no matter how long I stand awkwardly with one foot suspended over the gunwale waiting for the water to trickle out
- They also don't dry as quickly as I'd like, which isn't a big deal when I'm in and out of the canoe through the day, but I still need to bring a pair of campsite shoes if I want to be comfortable in the evening.

I've only been using these for a couple months, so I can't speak to the longevity, but so far, so good!
review.name: Best portaging shoe I've ever had

name: Tr1 Mesh Water Shoe - Men's

review.reviewBody: I've worn these on 6-7 rides so far and I'm very happy! Boa system works great... I banged the boa dials a few times and instead of breaking they just come loose and can be reattached. Cool system! The shoes are super comfortable.  Stiff enough for riding and climbing but still easy enough to hike-a-bike or walk around to check out lines. Nice looking shoe as well. Overall, I'm very pleased.  We'll see how they wear!  (note: I have narrow feet and these are very comfortable. They come w/ inserts for arch support which I didn't need too.)
review.name: Fantastic MTB Shoes!

review.reviewBody: The BOA system works great, and the overall shoe fits nice. The sole on the other hand after the 4th use has started to rip off. I would had expect more fore a shoe of that price. I will be going back to my 5.10 shoes.
review.name: Good shoe bad sole

review.reviewBody: This is the 4th Sinclair that I have purchased over the last 6 years.  The other 3 still look great, and I didnt need the 4th, but I hate shopping, really dig these shirts and BC had a smoking deal on them.  They're very warm, high quality, look great with most anything and last.  They fit me well, as do most Flylow shirts.  Im 5'9", 140 lbs and roll with a small.
review.name: Flylow Quality as Expected

review.reviewBody:
Rather than a lined flannel, this is actually quite warm, like a micro puff jacket. Its kinda bulky, taking up much more space in a bag than a flannel, but considering it's really a jacket with buttons I am starting to bring it as my only jacket for spring evenings or mountain summer weekend trips. If you're tired of always wearing technical jackets to casual outings all year this is a nice way to roll with some more casual style and still be warm in the 40s/50s. Fits large enough to go over med layers like fleece, hoody, sweater, or even a slim fitting micro puff jacket.

4 stars instead of 5 because the pockets are not very secure, can't hold a phone while moving around. Otherwise very comfortable and useful.
review.name: A jacket that masquerades as a flannel

name: Sinclair Insulated Flannel - Men's

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Great stove I just wish it came with or had an option for wind guards.
review.name: Wind guard

review.reviewBody: Our family has several stoves ranging in size for backpacking and kayaking to car camping to portable cooking for large crowds. This single burner is great by itself or in combo with a two burner or another single burner for weekend camping.  You save the room on your picnic table and the power of this stove boils water in a jiffy for coffee and cooks up breakfast for six in a jiffy using the single burner griddle (sold separately) on medium low heat.  We very rarely use our table top stoves anymore - the quality at 30k BTU output more than makes up for the added bulk if you have room.  Get yourself a two burner with griddle and bbq box and save this one for pans and coffee making on an open flame so you don't have to swap out accessories.  You'll be able to cook for the entire camp!  We have a dedicated 5lb tank for this and it will last a week with regular cooking.  I don't give out five stars easily - this unit earns every single one.
review.name: Great 'compact' versatile cooker.

review.reviewBody: Will this work with BBQ Grill Box BB30L -3 ???????
review.name: BB30L -3

review.reviewBody: Really nice to have a small stove for the shorter camping trips with less people! Really enjoying the quality and convenience of this stove.
review.name: Very Convenient!

review.reviewBody: Pretty darn awesome. solid build, a little bulky for transport but you wonâ€™t find something more compact at this level of quality. There is always a trade off when you add too much portability.
review.name: Solid!

review.reviewBody: Very versatile since we can use the stove with the optional grill/griddle. High quality and great if storage space is limited. We also installed the optional igniter which makes lighting the stove a breeze. Love it!
review.name: Very impressed with this stove

review.reviewBody: We've been looking for a burner for when we're out in our RV. We can't be any happier with it. It worked perfectly. The height is perfect and being able to remove the legs makes it easy to store and carry in the RV compartment.
review.name: Pro 30 Burner

review.reviewBody: I love this stove. Have a griddle, BBQ box and pizza oven. Also use cast iron dutch oven to fry fish. All are awsome. Only thing I wish it had is a wind screen. My double burner has one and makes it so much better. Overall great product.
review.name: Awsome except one thing

review.reviewBody: We love this stove for camping.  It has a nice flame, it's strong, it folds down nicely to put in the car, the cover is handy to hold cooking items, the legs are adjustable for uneven ground.  We have another 2-burner store on our screened in porch that we use for cooking stinky foods like fish.  We love it as well.  We just think this is a great company to buy from.
review.name: Great Stove--Great Company--Great Customer Support

review.reviewBody: I bought this to replace another outdoor burner stove.  This product is an example of a well made product.  It came fully assembled (minus attachment of the legs). It is well made and works perfectly.  I was so pleased with this purchase and would recommend this product completely.
review.name: Outdoor cooking

description: Buy the NEMO Equipment Inc. Tensor All-Season Sleeping Pad online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Tensor All-Season Sleeping Pad
hasVariant.description: Buy the NEMO Equipment Inc. Tensor All-Season Sleeping Pad online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: As a long-time owner of an old (narrow) Thermarest X-Therm, I grew tired of the noise of the thing (as did my neighbours). Buying an All-Season Tensor (long, wide) gave me the chance to directly compare the two side-by-side. There is considerable hype online about the 'silence' of the Tensor â€“ in my view, it's only marginally quieter than my old X-Therm. So if you're thinking of buying one of these in anticipation of quiet nights, you'll be disappointed. It's slightly more comfortable than the X-Therm, thanks to the thicker section and the fact that it has another 100mm of width (this, incidentally, is a good reason for side sleepers to go to a wide pad â€“ you can draw your knees up and not roll off the back of the pad). You pay for it in ounces, of course â€“ the Tensor is the heavier of the two â€“ but in my view, it's worth it.
review.name: Good, not great

review.reviewBody:
I've used just about every brand of sleeping pad on the market, and these newer Tensor pads are my favorite. Quite lightweight given the R-values, and small to pack. Durability has been great, and most importantly, the comfort is spot on. Other pads that have the baffles runnings all in one direction don't do it, either they're soft on the side and you roll off too easy, or thy bounce around and curl on you. The Tensor doesn't have either of those issues. Also very quiet.
My only items for improvement is that the tops of these should all be black or dark charcoal colored. Reason being with more people using quilts and having direct skin contact with the top surface, the sweat and grime really begins to build up and show nasty wear after a bit. Black will hide it so they look newer/cleaner longer.
Also, Nemo really need to offer a Regular Wide Mummy in these. Too many of the rectangle shape ones keep too much weight on for lightweight backpacking use.
review.name: Best available, but...

review.reviewBody: I have had my Tensor for a year now and I love the thickness and quietness of it. However, there are a few things to mention. One of my biggest gear regrets is not getting the wide version. While the regular version saves some weight, it really does sacrifice some comfort. If you are a back sleeper, it is not wide enough for both arms to rest on the pad. Don't be like me, the extra width is worth the extra weight. Another thing I have noticed is that it is prone to pinprick leaks. I have gotten a few but they patched up great and haven't had any recent issues.
review.name: All around pretty good

review.reviewBody: I bought the Tensor All-Season for it being quieter than the other pads I have tried. And it is! However, I was worried about durability and it does seem thiner than other brands. On the 5th night of usage, and only when car camping (thank goodness I never brought it on a multi day into the back country), it had a small leak that I could not find in the middle of the night so I slept on the ground. It was also before a big trail run (34+ miles) :( My other pads have been going strong for two seasons and I wish I brought them as a back-up.
review.name: Great but not durable!
comment: Thank you for leaving a review and I'm sorry to hear about this experience! I can see our awesome CS team is already assisting you with a warranty claim.

review.reviewBody:
I used the Nemo Tensor on a biketour of Iceland and was impressed with the performance and comfort of this pad. Temperatures in mid-May ranged from 25-50 degrees Fahrenheit in numerous different landscapes and weather. I was never cold despite these changing conditions (with a 20 degree sleeping bag).

This pad has a quick inflation pump sack which I found takes about 4-5 uses to fully inflate the pad. Deflation is also easy, the pad can be packed up simultaneously during the deflation process.

Comfort was excellent, the 3.5 inch thickness kept me completely off the ground as a back and side sleeper. I slept on this pad for about 20 days with no issues.

The one thing I read about this pad was that it is loud. During the setup I noticed the noise because it was the most movement of the pad. Once it was setup I never noticed it, the wind against my tent was often louder than the pad.

I would absolutely recommend buying this pad and I plan to get another. I personally like the wide pad, the fractional weight of a smaller pad is not worth it if you don't fit. Between the comfort, packability, weight and durability, this pad should be considered by anyone looking for a good night sleep.
review.name: Comfortable Sleeping Pad with Great Functionality

review.reviewBody: Really love my Nemo Tensor Insulated Regular with R Value of 2.7, but couldnâ€™t pass up the chance to try the improved, All-Season version that claimed to be more comfortable (thicker) and warmer (R Value 4.2) at the same weight!  I tried it out during a February hike of the 75-mile Georgia section of the AT and it performed flawlessly.
review.name: The best just got better

review.reviewBody: I got the Tensor All-Season for a mid-May trip with temps overnight forecast into the high 30s. I brought a 30 degree down quilt vs my 15 degree bag as my pack space was limited. I was not once cold! I am so impressed. Durability seems more than adequate with zero issues even though we slept on rocks one night. I also worried about sliding off and that did not happen â€” I got the wide rectangular option as I tend to flop about from side to side. Width at 25â€ was adequate for this! One feedback is that I personally dislike folding up things in thirds and returning to a small sack each morning â€” might there be a zippered rectangular stuff sack with room to put the 1/2 folded pad and inflation bag into with less â€˜stuffingâ€™? I basically did not use the stuff sack and folded the pad in half then rolled it â€” securing it with the included velcro strap. Itâ€™s a small issue really and for someone that likes to out minimal effort out to pack up. One other tricky aspect relates to inflating â€” I pulled the inflation bag off a few times just before reaching full. The angle seems a bit unnatural for avoiding this â€” again, Iâ€™m nitpicking as it was manageable with practice. I topped off with a few breathes, too. I do wish Nemo would offer a mini pump option â€” or I may get a third party one for ease. Depending on how much air you get into the inflation sack, it too me up to 10-12 rolls to reach full. I also bought a sheet from another company and it did not fit so had to abandon the idea â€” and maybe it is not needed in hindsight. Overall, I am quite impressed and sold you might say on Nemo quality.
review.name: Three nights, not once cold

review.reviewBody: I bought the rectangle wide and itâ€™s been great ! Just recently brought it camping on the islands of Saranac Lake NY and it was extremely warm and comfortable. I really appreciated that thickness upgrade. Also it is very light weight, small, easy to pack, easy to inflate. All around great sleeping pad!
review.name: Nemo Tensor All Season

review.reviewBody: Still remains one of the best pads on the market currently. I've used the Regular Wide size several times for backpacking and it's a hard one to beat.  I've tested it 60 degree temperature and 20 degree. Both times it did not disappoint, especially in 20 degrees. It's light, super packable, and very quite compared to other air pads. The only reason I am giving it a 4/5 is because it is not super comfortable for side sleepers.  Though this issue can be resolved by adding a switchback underneath for additional padding.
review.name: Top Tier Pad On The Market

review.reviewBody: Though I have yet to use this pad, I can confidently say of the ~7 pads Iâ€™ve owned, this is the best.  It packs down ultra small and is incredibly lightweight, comfortable, and the dimensions (70â€x25â€) fit my BA sleeping bagâ€™s integrated pad sleeves perfectly.  Iâ€™ll have to take Nemoâ€™s word on the R value for now, but Iâ€™ll try and update this review once I test it.  Itâ€™s a bit crinkly when you move around and I wish it had elevated sides to hold me in place at night, but Iâ€™m not so bummed as to remove a star from my rating.  Overall itâ€™s a great pad :)
review.name: Fits my Big Agnes Daisy Mae perfectly

name: Tensor All-Season Sleeping Pad

review.reviewBody: Greaaat shorts. Fit me better than just about any other shorts I've tried on in the last 7 years. Seriously. I bought a pink pair of these Joya shorts in person and adored them, ordered another pair from Backcountry website in the same size and they weren't quite right. It looks like there was a mess up in the manufacturing that wasn't caught, the material and sewing was a bit bunched up causing them to fit weird. BUT, BUY THESE SHORTS! Wherever you get them from, they are PERFECT for climbing and PERFECT for those who are a little thicker on their bottom half. They aren't too tight but keep your bits private when climbing above ur belayer. Good shorts. They run a teeny bit small if you don't want them to be tight. I usually wear a small but I had to get a medium in these.
review.name: Not quite right

name: Joya Short - Women's

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Super comfortable and stretchy!  These are great for those that are always moving
review.name: love these

review.reviewBody: Got these pants for work and they are great. The quality is superb. I chose a size 6 in the 12 inch option and they fit just where I needed them. I included a lot of pictures for reference. Iâ€™m 5â€™7, and 118 lbs.
review.name: Good quality and fit.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Fits perfectly but like some other Columbia bottoms I did size up.
review.name: Versatile

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] These are nice light weight hiking shorts with good pockets.  The fabric is flexible and good quality.  My problem is the sizing.  I ordered one size larger than my normal, too small.  I ordered 2 sizes bigger, still too small.  I returned and won't reorder.
review.name: Weird sizing

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Skin tight. I have many other Columbia size 12 garments. These for more like biker shorts. Just be aware. I assumed active fit meant â€œmoves with you, gives, flexes.â€
review.name: Not quite my fit fave

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Great do everything shorts, great color and easy to cuff them to the perfect length.
review.name: Love them

review.reviewBody: Great shorts!   Fit well.  Nice material, light, comfortable.   Good color.   Very happy with the purchase.
review.name: Great shorts!

review.reviewBody: Just received these shorts today. When Columbia says active fit I know to buy a size up as this means these shorts are made for the â€œyoungerâ€ consumer. They are a snug fit for sure with lots of give in the legs and the seat but not the waist.  If you are over 50 you may want to order two sizes up for a more comfortable fit. They appear well made and should hold up for any activity.
review.name: Active fit means snug fit.

review.reviewBody: When I purchased two new pair to replace some worn pairs I noticed the material was much better than previous years. Unfortunately the cut was also changed to a lower riser and a smaller fit in the waist. 12 too tight, yet my 10â€™s still fit me. Probably because they sit on the hip not the waist.
review.name: Fit changed from previous years

review.reviewBody: I just got back from fishing the Henryâ€™s Fork used my new Ultradisc UDLA Fly Reel for the first time and the drag is perfect in a large Harper allows for a quick pick up a line. Iâ€™m so happy with it I bought 2 more.
review.name: Beautiful reel

review.reviewBody: Smooth disc drag and integrated line guard. Issue free from day one
review.name: Smooth

review.reviewBody:
My first purchase of a Hardy reel, (UDLA 7000) bought to house a new Rio WF8 Floater.
My usual reels are Waterworks SLA or Nautilus. I must say this reel definitely gives the Waterworks a run for it's money, both on price price point and quality, looking forward to the new season to use it in anger properly.
review.name: Beautifully engineered reel

review.reviewBody:
The reel is very well constructed and the drag is quite nice. There are two issues I've had that are preventing a 5 star rating. The first is that, while the drag is really nice and I love the positive clicks when changes are made, the interval between each click is too great.  I hooked into a large brown trout in heavy current and attempted to make an on-the-fly adjustment, user error I turned the know the wrong direction but the reel went from not quite enough drag to almost no drag with one click. I panicked a bit and turned the knob the correct direction, but went 3 clicks instead of 2 and the drag clamped down hard and the fish could no longer pull line. Fearing for my 6x tippet I finally managed to get one click back and got the amount of drag I was initially looking for.  I would have preferred to have a little more graduation between clicks instead of going from no useful drag to too much drag in 4 clicks.

The second issue, admittedly might be me not being a great euro nymph caster, but the half cage has these little prongs that have caught my fly line a number of times in the previous few days of use. I've included a picture of this issue.

All that being said, the reel seems quite tough, very attractive, a nice weight, and a good value.
review.name: Very nice reel for the price

review.reviewBody:
I just read the only other review about the UDLA reel and it sounds more like operator error than reel function.
Iâ€™ve fished this reel since it was introduced in various situations and I really enjoy the simplicity and weight of this reel, the drag knob is large and easy to adjust and a definitive click between settings.
The weight and large arbor are the most noticeable features, this translates to quick line retrieval and the ability to fish longer because of its weight. Ive been nothing but pleased with itâ€™s performance.
review.name: the Lightweight advantage of the reel,

name: Ultradisc UDLA Fly Reel

review.reviewBody: Awesome pant! Great fit, super stretchy and stylish at the same time. My go to every day pant.
review.name: Great fitting pant!

review.reviewBody: Love them. Comfortable and acceptable as business casual
review.name: Mountain Business Casual

review.reviewBody: I bought these back in April and finally broke them out. The stitching started to come undone as soon as I sat down. Terrible quality from a brand I once loved.
review.name: Terrible stitching

review.reviewBody: The material was great! Love the pants except they run just a little small. Otherwise excellent
review.name: Fit

review.reviewBody: Solid pants, very comfortable, a little long. They seem incredibly durable.
review.name: Solid

review.reviewBody: These pants feel great and can be used indoors and outdoors. It has UPF 50 built-in which I great for protection of your skin. The stretch in the pants allow great flexibility for movement. The only concern is how they will last, the stitching is coming out with about month of wear.
review.name: Great all around pants, but the stitching is coming out after a month of use

review.reviewBody: Terrible pants. Low quality stitching that falls apart after first use. Mountain hardware doesnâ€™t stand behind their products either.
review.name: Do not buy, find a different brand completely

review.reviewBody:
The Hardwear AP line has been my favorite pants since it was introduced years ago. I own 3 pairs of the regular AP pant which has become my daily pants instead of jeans. I use the AP active pants for climbing and hiking and I appreciate the shorter cut and the material is great for being outside all day. 

I did notice that the AP Active pant material is a bit of a softer nylon/polyester compared to the old AP pants. Itâ€™s very comfortable but I worry about durability.  Iâ€™ve been using them at the climbing gym and outside for the last 5 months, so far so good. 

I hope Mountain Hardwear doesnâ€™t change the design and fit of these.  They are awesome.
review.name: My favorite pants

review.reviewBody:
These pants are some of the most comfortable and flexible pants I have owned, however after wearing them for 4 or 5 days, and a 3 day weekend hike, they are starting to pile and have developed snags in the knees.

I will absolutely continue to wear them, but they have already been relegated to a field pant, unfortunately.
review.name: Snags and piles

review.reviewBody: Love these pants, the 36 fits perfect and the 34 length is actually long enough. Great pant to wear to work in the office then right to play after. Ordering more in various colours.
review.name: Best casual/active pant for summer

name: Hardwear AP Active Pant - Men's

review.itemreviewed: Speedgoat 5 GTX Spike Trail Running Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: When I ware these shoes, I sound like a horse on sidewalks! Only good for rugged trails. Not for everyday use.
review.name: No; except for hiking rugged trails.

review.itemreviewed: Speedgoat 5 GTX Spike Trail Running Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: Excellent protection for a 78 yr old runner with arthritis in his feet. The firm platform with good gripping action is great for me.
review.name: I am buying this shoe for the second time

review.itemreviewed: Speedgoat 5 GTX Spike Trail Running Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: I work long hours on my feet most the day and walk at least 6-8 miles a day. Was looking for a shoe with comfort and grip. The foam on these are not very giving and don't provide much cushion making it uncomfortable after long hours on my feet. They do have good grip and the gtx works great from keeping my feet dry in the rain. If you're looking for a shoe to wear for long hours on your feet I would not recommend this model but it would make for a good hiking/trail running shoe.

review.itemreviewed: Speedgoat 5 GTX Spike Trail Running Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: So comfortable, I have wide foot and the half a point more fit perfect, thanks for so good hiking and walk shoes:
review.name: Love this shoes

review.itemreviewed: Speedgoat 5 GTX Spike Trail Running Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: Great looking shoe - plenty of cushion which is why I wear hokas. They fit a little small so I bought a size up. Spikes are noisy on pavement and hard floors. The Vibram sole should last better as I put some serious miles on these.
review.name: Great shoe for Rucking

review.itemreviewed: Speedgoat 5 GTX Spike Trail Running Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: Really great feel to these shoes, running on cross country trails in winter AK. Gortex and seams keep feet very dry. Absolutely great traction. Much more comfortable than I expected for gortex and spikes.
review.name: Comfort and control on the ice

review.itemreviewed: Speedgoat 5 GTX Spike Trail Running Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: I bought these Speedgoats because HOKA doesn't make a waterproof Stinson 7. I wanted to capture the magic the Gaviota 5's made in my life when out on the golf course in me middle of winter (a mid-state California winter but still cold and wet). The Stinson 7 looks ro be the trail version of the Gaviota 5 but not waterproof. So I bought the Speedgoat with spikes just for the gtx lining. Low expectations but I was amazed. Even though they sound like studded snow tires on dry pavement they grip the ground as I track my golf ball hither and yon. The laces release from a "heel lock lacing" easier than the Gaviotas. I don't know if the spikes add anything to the Speedgoat's grip on wer grass and dirt, but they make my feet feel great after a round.
review.name: Another HOKA game changer

review.itemreviewed: Speedgoat 5 GTX Spike Trail Running Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: Should offer the spikes in the GTX mid model. Ran the trail w/a trace of snow and ankles and feet got wet.
review.name: SG4 GTX w/Spikes

review.itemreviewed: Speedgoat 5 GTX Spike Trail Running Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: I bought these for midwestern winter. I haven't used 'em yet.
review.name: First time with Spikes

review.itemreviewed: Speedgoat 5 GTX Spike Trail Running Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: I love hookers, and decided to look into whether they had golf shoes. I was shocked that they did, and ordered them. When they arrived, it was just in time for my member guest golf tournament. When the pro heard the metal clicks walking across pavement, there was concerned about how almost no courses allow old metal spikes. These are constructed in a way that does not harm greens or grass.
review.name: Best golf shoes in over 50 years. Courses allow them

name: Speedgoat 5 GTX Spike Trail Running Shoe - Men's

review.reviewBody: Super comfy they preform great. The only complaint i have is the cable lace system. I feel sidi tried to reinvent the wheel rather than use actual boa system.
review.name: Great shoes

review.reviewBody: Iâ€™ve been wearing Sidi for years for the quality and comfort.  These shoes did not dissapoint. They were a great buy!
review.name: Fantastic shoe from Sidi

review.reviewBody: I started with a lower quality cheaper version of the Sidi and eventually after trying on, I decided to upgrade to this one.  Backcountry customer service was great with exchanges and prompt shipping .
review.name: Excellent shoe at a reasonable price

review.reviewBody: Used to mountain bike, a lot, now pretty much 70:30 road:gravel.  Pretty much exclusively SIDI, I've got "frankenfeet", typically SIDI works best for my fit case.  By swapping pedals had used both my typical road set up and MTB/Gravel setup and preferred road.  My MTB shoes were a bit heavy and "overbuilt" for the type of gravel riding that I do the most of.  These new "gravel" shoes are best of both worlds.  SPD cleats, walkable lugged sole, good power transfer but with the right amount of flex for riding gravel.  Comfortable right out of the box although I think they do run a bit small and I do have a wide foot so I went up a half size and they are perfect.  I wasn't sure I'd like the single BOA closure system but although I usually have to tighten a click or two a couple time early in the ride you end up with great tension distribution across the whole system as the tension equalizes while you are riding.  These are brilliant, really happy with them and if they are as "bulletproof" as SIDI's other top end shoes I expect many seasons of hard use and great performance.
review.name: Gravel Great

review.reviewBody: Super nice shoes
review.name: Shoes

review.reviewBody: Have had a number of gravel shoes. Average tendency is to last maybe a year before they're either thrashed by terrain or just plain worn out. I've had this pair of Sidi over two years and it has seen some abuse. Still looks good, still fits like a glove and boa mechanism still functioning flawlessly. This pair was more than my usual shoe price target but it was well worth the purchase. Regret not considering Sidi earlier. Would buy again.
review.name: High quality, incredibly comfortable

review.reviewBody: The first red flag was my foot ripping out of them a couple times. Second red flag was the twist closer broke- luckily it broke in a tight position. Rather than investing any more, i left it broken and got shoes my foot wouldnâ€™t rip out of. I keep them around because they make a nice slip on for my trainer. I recommend them for trainers and road
review.name: Theyâ€™re ok

review.reviewBody: I just got the shoe and like the way it fits. I do have some concerns with the boa closure system. in a recent race the shoe closure device got jammed after getting mud on it. I tried to loosen my shoe at one point and it was a no go. I later had to tear the shoe off my foot and fiddle for a long time to get the system freed and working again. BUMMER

name: Gravel Cycling Shoe - Men's

review.reviewBody: I like the style of the hat as well as like the initial appearance, but not a fan of how it looks on my head. review.itemreviewed: S/Pro Alpha 110 EL Ski Boot - 2024 - Women's
review.reviewBody: I did not find these boots to be as good for my bunions as the Supra boa boot is.  Additionally, when these boots were buckled so that my foot was snuggly held, my feet got cold-all while indoors. Needless to say, I opted for the Supra boa and returned these.
review.name: Narrow toe box
comment: Hey, thank you for taking the time to share your feedback with us. We often adjust our products based on direct customer feedback. We will make sure to pass this along to our designers for consideration in future products.

review.itemreviewed: S/Pro Alpha 110 EL Ski Boot - 2024 - Women's
review.reviewBody: I don't know who Salomon makes boots for when they get rid of the their 120 flex women's ski boot and calls their super soft 110 boots for "experts." A Salomon rep told me I don't weigh enough to ski the 120 flex and pushed me to the 110 instead. They kind of suck. Hey Salomon, women whose feet are smaller than the men's boots are capable of skiing hard too. Want to make a boot for us, or should I go back to wearing Lange?
review.name: Pillow Soft Flex

review.itemreviewed: S/Pro Alpha 110 EL Ski Boot - 2024 - Women's
review.reviewBody: My foot measures 10â€ long, 100mm wide. Iâ€™m typically a 24.5 across manufacturers. I skied the 24.5 for two short shifts and had a hard time feeling anything due to the tightness that never eased up. I sized up to 25.5 and I am impressed. This boot is responsive and has a great forward flex for steeps and long shifts patrolling. If youâ€™re an intermediate looking to advance or already an expert, this boot performs. Itâ€™s snug, but comfortable and warm. I use disposable toe warmers when itâ€™s less than 28 degrees and still love the fit & feel of this boot. No
review.name: S PRO ALPHA W

review.itemreviewed: S/Pro Alpha 110 EL Ski Boot - 2024 - Women's
review.reviewBody: I bought the old version of these (S/Pro 110 w) two years ago and they've probably had 60 days on them total. They now need to be replaced because the plastic has lost all stiffness and is probably flexing like a 70 flex boot. I'm not sure if that's due to the materials, the form, or my skiing, but either way it's super disappointing.
review.name: Shell softens fast!

review.itemreviewed: S/Pro Alpha 110 EL Ski Boot - 2024 - Women's
review.reviewBody: I have nothing but praise for this boot. I skied first to last chair for 5 days straight on this boot right out of the box and they were amazing! I ski aggressively and it handled it all from steeps to bumps to knee deep fresh powder in the trees.  Hands down the most comfortable performance boot I've ever had. Extremely precise and fantastic power transfer.
review.name: Most comfortable performance boot

review.itemreviewed: S/Pro Alpha 110 EL Ski Boot - 2024 - Women's
review.reviewBody:
"I can't speak highly enough about the Salomon S/Pro Alpha 110W boots. Simply, they rip. Salomon moved the two lower buckles back a bit in this boot and it made a huge difference; my heel actually does feel locked in place with zero movement. Merge that with its low profile design and ample toe box which keeps blood flowing to my inevitable cold toes, the S/Pro Alpha 110W fits like a glove. I ski with custom liners so I canâ€™t speak to the fit of the Alphaâ€™s factory liners, but the snugness and performance of the shell is unmatched. Even with custom liners and Booster straps my foot usually moves around more than I want, but not in these boots. 

The S/Pro Alpha 110W is stiff and responsive. It can take the power you put into it, and it wants you to do so; it flexes just enough when you need it and pushes back when need the support. Chase the pros down groomers and through variable conditions like a champ, and when it comes to buttery powder, this bootâ€™s glove-like fit responds exactly how you want it to. I'm based in Lake Tahoe and mainly ski Palisades, though I was able to bring these on a Utah trip this year as well. I highly recommend this boot for any women looking for a ski boot that matches their strength and aggressive ski style."
review.name: Finally, a powerful women's boot that rips.

review.itemreviewed: S/Pro Alpha 110 EL Ski Boot - 2024 - Women's
review.reviewBody: This boot had a great out of the box fit for my narrow foot. I would also say that the power transfer I experienced was phenomenal and I enjoyed the aggressive forward lean in the boot.
review.name: S/Pro Alpha 110 W

review.itemreviewed: S/Pro Alpha 110 EL Ski Boot - 2024 - Women's
review.reviewBody: I was able to use this boot for most of the Spring season, and am extremely impressed with the comfort and control I felt. I usually have to tweak my boots quite a bit for my feet to not go numb after a couple hours skiing. Although the S/Pro Alpha has the ability to make endless adjustments through heat molding/stretching of plastic, I found that just after one session of cooking them, they are even more comfortable than my prior boots. I am extremely pleased with the precision and control I feel skiing these. Best boot I've had!
review.name: Comfortable and Responsive!

review.itemreviewed: S/Pro Alpha 110 EL Ski Boot - 2024 - Women's
review.reviewBody:
I could rave for hours about the excellence of the Salomon S/Pro Alpha 110W ski boot. It's honestly the most comfortable and responsive boot I've ever skied. I have pretty sensitive feet, so getting new ski boots is a BIG DEAL for me, and I dread the break-in period. Well, let me just start with the fact that I experienced zero discomfort on DAY ONE after following proper setup instructions. It felt like I had been skiing in those boots for half a season on my first day. Just a few days in, I skied bell-to-bell on a powder day, and the same thing â€” pure bliss on my feet and toes, something I haven't quite experienced with any ski boot.

Now let's talk about the functionality and stiffness of the boot. I'm a pretty technical skier, so sidestepping and boot packing was a breeze in these babies, and it felt good. I felt there was the right amount of stiffness for me to lay down some turns on a groomer day and charge on a powder day. I even recommend keeping these boots on for a beer or two; that's how great they are. =)
review.name: Incredible Ski Boot

name: S/Pro Alpha 110 EL Ski Boot - 2024 - Women's

review.reviewBody:
These boots are great! I use them for my work as a groundskeeper.  In rain and snow they keep my feet dry and warm.  Hopping in and out of a golf cart or walking all day, they are comfortable and not clunky.  I am so grateful for the vegan feature too!  Thank you Astral for these boots!  

Half a size larger fit perfectly for me.
review.name: Grateful!

review.reviewBody: Super comfortable and lightweight. As always with Astral, grip is exceptional!
review.name: My Second Pair!

review.reviewBody: I have had these boots for over a year and I wear them regularly for work and for hiking.  They were comfortable right out of the box.  I put them on for the first time and hiked McAfee's Knob with no issues whatsoever.  The water proofing is great and is still hanging in there.  I have had several other types of hiking boots and none have lasted as well as these have.  I will certainly get another pair when and if these run out of gas.
review.name: Amazing boot

review.reviewBody: The boots are very well manufactured. The quality in the material is impressive. After wearing Altra lone peak mids for years I would say the Pisgahâ€™s seem over engineered compared to Altraâ€™s. Which is good thing! Altaâ€™s just donâ€™t hold up for long. I work a job that requires black boots. It is hard to find a boot that has a wide toe box and zero drop. I figured I would try these since Alta doesnâ€™t have a black color way this year. I was very impressed with the Pisgahâ€™s quality although the toe box feels a bit more cramped when comparing the two. The Alstrals fit more snug all the way around my foot. After two days of wearing them I severely sprained my ankle. Not blaming the Pisgahâ€™s I just think itâ€™s because they are more stiff and not as flexible around the ankle. I would recommend this company just not sure if the boots are gonna work long term for me.
review.name: Quality product butâ€¦

review.reviewBody: Iâ€™ve had these for two years.  used during the winter and for day hiking. They are fairly comfortable and wear well. However, they have more cushioning than Iâ€™d like and the waterproofing wears out after about a year.
review.name: Ok but donâ€™t stay waterproof

review.reviewBody: Absolutely worth it. The sole being modeled after my favorite shoe (TR1), I have no complaints. While the quality of other large brands continues to decline, Astral continues to make stand-out products that deliver what they say and withstand real-world abuse. Please keep up the good work, or I'll be forced to go barefoot.
review.name: High-Quality Boots

review.reviewBody: Very comfortable and versatile shoe. You won't find another shoe brand with grippier rub. I love the confidence and safety the grip provides.
review.name: Excellent Shoe

review.reviewBody: Very comfortable, stylish and perfect for wet and snowy conditions.
review.name: Love my Pisgah in the snow

review.reviewBody: Used to Loyaks, all I usually wear, these are great for cold weather when I want my feet warm and dry.
review.name: My weatherproof footwear, my loyak alternative!

review.reviewBody: I bought these boots a couple months ago for a hiking trip to New Zealand's South island. I wanted something light, comfortable, sturdy, grippy, waterproof and good looking enough to wear out to a casual dinner. After wearing these for almost three weeks and hiking an average of seven miles each day, I can confirm that these checked all the boxes. From urban exploring in Sydney to glacier hiking around Mt. Cook and Franz Josef, these boots were amazing. And they still look new! They ran true to size for me and have great space in the toe box while providing excellent support. Great product.
review.name: Great Boot for Both Hiking and Urban Exploring

name: Pisgah Boot - Men's

review.reviewBody: A Fantastic fleece, lovely fit and design. Unfortunately 1 years worth of wear has really taken its toll. I have worn this fleece a lot, I love it (certainly not everyday) but it's had a lot of casual everyday use over the past year. Unfortunately the fleece has bobbled and piled in areas, more than a usual fleece should. Some parts of the fleece have also worn down too easily - the arms/cuffs for example are now very thin and don't feel comfortable against the skin anymore. Not as quality a product as Fjallraven should be in my opinion. However the green fleece I also own and has stood the test of time a bit better. All in all a great fleece let down by 1 years worth of casual everyday wear (but now looks like it's a couple of years old at least!).
review.name: Great Design let down by Fleece Quality?

name: Vardag Lite Fleece Jacket - Men's

review.reviewBody: I love these, favorite Ferrosi's so far. I am 5'4, 130lb and bought size Small. They are thin, so I don't expect them to last a super long time, but they are my favorite light climbing, guiding and hiking pants. If OR would make them in bright, skittles colors, with contrasting drawstrings, I would be overjoyed. If Or would also make a thicker, reinforced version for trad climbing, I would be doubly overjoyed.
review.name: Please make these in bright colors!

review.reviewBody: I really loved these at first as a great casual or light technical pant, but they're already pilling everywhere after washing them 2-3 times. Way too expensive for these to be so cheaply made. Bummed that OR seems to be going downhill in quality.
review.name: Already heavily pilling after a few wears

review.reviewBody: I wanted to love these. I love the fit and feel of these joggers. However, the fabric is not durable at all. I've worn them only two times and as another reviewer noted, they pill badly. On the first wear I only wore them casually and I noticed some pilling on the thighs. The next time I wore them on a short hike with my dog and there was a bad area of pilling extending from the seam by my left pocket out onto the top of my bum. I'm not even sure what would have rubbed there. They are now essentially ruined as they look too awful to wear casually now and will continue to get worse if I use them in situations that is hard on the pants.
review.name: This fabric is not durable

review.reviewBody: Love these. Love the fit, fabric and style. I usually wear leggings hiking but wanted something more durable and still flexible. These fit the bill perfectly. I'm 5'5", 155. lb and got a medium. They are a little baggy but not too bad. I like them a bit more flowy.
review.name: Been looking for a pant to replace leggings

review.reviewBody: I was so excited to try these pants! I am on a trip in Nevada and bought these for the trip. The pants were so wonderfully comfortable for the plane ride. I wore these for our hike through Red Rock Canyon as well. That was the first adventure that these pants saw. I sat on the red rocks, never dragged my butt. The entire surface of the butt is thinning and the fabric is pilled. For such an expensive pair of pants, I am incredibly saddened. I was really looking forward to them.
review.name: The absolute comfiest, but not at all durable

review.reviewBody: These pants are perfect for all sorts of outdoor pursuits! But I'm 5'2" and these pants are just too long for me. Please consider carrying short sizes. Thanks!
review.name: Please make these in short sizes!

review.reviewBody: Finally, the absolute perfect pair of pants!! I am so excited! I have long been obsessed with the Ferrosi fabric, and joggers are my favorite style of pants. They are legitimately the most comfortable and functional pants I've ever owned and I hope they make so many more colors. I fluctuate between the 16 and 16W sizes in the regular Ferrosi pants, and the XL in the joggers fit me perfectly. I could also probably wear the XXL but they'd be significantly looser than the model in the pic and I like them a little form fitting. I would say to size down if you're in between sizes unless you want them baggy. The drawstring waist is so comfy and non-restrictive, and the cuffs hit right at the ankle of my 5'10" frame. They are the perfect amount of stretchy but hold their shape, they're super breathable and water resistant, and honestly more comfortable than most of my pajama pants! Way to go OR!
review.name: THESE ARE ALL I'VE EVER WANTED AND MORE

name: Ferrosi Joggers - Women's

review.reviewBody: I have a Hubba Hubba tent (which i absolutely LOVE) but to my surprise, the elastics in the poles have lost all of their elasticity and make it real hard to set up my tent - how can I replace the poles? thank you
review.name: HUBBA HUBBA 2 man tent

review.reviewBody: The shock cord in my 2.4 meter MSR adjustable pole wore out and broke, not a surprise. I bought the replacement cord but cannot figure out how to replace the broken one. Your video shows how to replace the cord in a tent pole but does not apply at all with this pole. The cord seems to be attached to the inside of 2 sections of the pole by a small metal disc to which the cord is tied. The disc fell out when I tried to grab the broken cord. How do I secure the replacement cord to the inside of the two pole sections?
review.name: MSR Adjustable Pole cord replacement

review.reviewBody: I have a Mutha Hubba NX 3 since few years. Use it few times in for hiking the first year and it was really great. I did not have to use it for two years but when I used it this weekend, the elastic pole was broken and I had to cut it to be able to assemble the tent... It is a bid disapointment.
review.name: Elastic pole

review.reviewBody:
I love the hubba hubba design and ease of setup but the poles have really worn down over the years with very little use, despite being stored well. 
I would love support with replacing them because itâ€™s not straightforward from your website. Itâ€™s a shame Iâ€™ll have to dish out more cash for replacements as I feel itâ€™s truly a quality issue
review.name: Poles poor quality

review.reviewBody: Yes like other customers I also had 2 bent tent poles from MSR mine the Elixer 2 tent ,,contacted the shop I bought from,,Alpine Trek ,,then Cascade ,,then MSR ,,complete joke everyone off them I have only had the tent six months ,they did not want to know half a dozen emails,,there out come was they donâ€™t replace tent poles only fix them for you ,,which they recon could take up to 2 months or more ,,donâ€™t buy off this company look at hundreds reviews from all over same treatment wonâ€™t buy anything again from this company the after service is just unreal arrogant company just simple send yours back and they should send you a new set but no thatâ€™s to easy mine were bent on delivery and they still would not change them ,,so beware,,Stewart Wilts
review.name: Bent Elixer 2 MSR tent poles

review.reviewBody: Iâ€™m not a happy camper. One of Elixir poles broke from bending. It wasnâ€™t the cord; it was the aluminum. Not a good thing.
review.name: Poles

review.reviewBody:
I Bought the Mutha Hubba tent a few years back. I loved it on the first through hikes I did with it (easy to build, great fabric, light, spacious). Everything I was looking for. Unfortunately after a couple of years, the elastic thread holding the poles together and supporting the build lost all its elasticity, becoming much longer. It makes it impossible to fit the poles together so to build the tent and make sure it holds properly (no way I sleep in it in windy conditions). It is a shame since I took good care of it (the rest is intact and I haven't lost any piece).
I'm based in France and there is no SAV, nor clear possibility to buy spare parts. I find it crazy that I cannot just replace the thread or even the structure easily since it is a small part of the whole. This product is too costly not to offer proper/equal support & parts to all customers.
review.name: Great product at first but degraded quickly (structure) - Not support in Europe

review.reviewBody: It is great! Exactly what I was looking for. Thanks
review.name: It is great! Exactly what

review.reviewBody:
Hi,

which size of the poles are used with the Rendezvous 120 & 200?
review.name: Using with MSR Rendezvous

review.reviewBody: Hello, I am a fan of the MSR brand. A pole on my hubba hubba hp tent broke during an expedition. I have to replace it. I live in France. How to buy the frame of the tent, is it possible and where? THANKS
review.name: Hubba Hubba HP
