description: Buy the MSR WindBurner Hanging Kit online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: WindBurner Hanging Kit
hasVariant.description: Buy the MSR WindBurner Hanging Kit online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: The hanging system works okay. However the wires melt the insulation around the cup and there is no easy way to remove the insulation to prevent this.
review.name: Functional but has issues

review.reviewBody: Before attaching this and running your stove, remove the insulator from windburner cup. You can use a separate pot handle to pour from the cup but using this with the insulator on WILL burn it.
review.name: Use some sense.

review.reviewBody: First of all, I love the WindBurner-system and MSR! For the next week we are planning a climbing-trip, so I bought the Hanging Kit, since it is designed to meet the needs of these activities. Today I tested the Hanging Kit for the first time with my 1.8 L pot on my balcony. I assembled the stove and the Hanging Kit according to the instructions. I started the stove, let it warm up until the wire glowed and put the full pot (1 L of water; ""Max Fill"" mark) on the stove and let the water boil. After that I recognized that one wire melted into the insulated cozy (see pictures). On the second try, I again put the full 1.8 L pot (1 L of water) on the WindBurner directly after starting the stove. The damage did not recur, so I thought it was my fault, because I had let the stove warm up at the first try so that the wires had got heated. Third try; this time with my full 1 L pot (aprox. 0,6 L or 20 oz of water; ""Max Fill"" mark). I started the stove, immediately put the pot on the hanging WindBurner. Seconds after the assembly, again one wire started to melt the insulated cozy (see pictures). I aborted my testings instantly. In conclusion of my testings under normal conditions (10 CÃ‚Â° or 50 FÃ‚Â°; almost windless), I cannot recommend this product because it potentionally melts the insulated cozy.
review.name: Potentionally melts down the insulated cozy!

review.reviewBody: This hanging system for the Windburner is really nice to have in bigwall climbing and in high-altitude camp. In those place, is hard to find a flat surface to put the system on. With this lightweight system, you can hang your Windburner everywhere. This is an awesome item for every climber and alpinist who own the Windburner Stove System.
review.name: Simple product, but really useful!

name: WindBurner Hanging Kit

description: Buy the Simms Dry Creek Z 12L Sling online or shop all Travel from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Dry Creek Z 12L Sling
hasVariant.description: Buy the Simms Dry Creek Z 12L Sling online or shop all Travel from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Use it in salt water over 100 nights a year. Main compartment was remarkably waterproof for 2 seasons so much so that if the water rose higher than the bag i would float. It now slowly leaks when submerged despite me routinely lubricating the seal. Once saltwater gets in you have to clean everything stored inside the bag plus the bag itself so not really worth using anymore. Additionally the outside pocket zipper corroded after a year of use. The pocket is now stuck shut. Overall I like the design, the straps keep it in place when casting a surf rod and liked being able to slide it to in front of me to access the contents without taking it off. Unfortunately it didn't hold up which is what I expect when spending extra on Simms.
review.name: Great while it lasted

review.reviewBody: Good waterproofing. once you get used to the straps you can dial in a system of how you best want to sling and swing it. could use an additional set of mesh pockets opposite the others inside. Keep use the included lube for the zip closure if it gets dry over time. I use the lanyard attachments for my large net and my plier/forceps rig.
review.name: Mu go to in fringe weather especiially!

review.reviewBody: I used it on my recent fishing trip to Christmas Island and lived it
Use it alot where where deeper wading is a must especially salt water
review.name: Keeps essentials dry

review.reviewBody: Zipper is hard as hell to open, super inconvenient to use as a guide
review.name: Super inconvenient and annoying to use

review.reviewBody: May be returning it, first off great construction, however getting the net in and out is a night mare and it does not hold a standard net without constantly falling out . poor net design
review.name: poor net pocket design

review.reviewBody: Stays on my back really nicely. Perfect size for a day on the water. Zipper works well and Looks great. Another great product from Simms!
review.name: Great bag

review.reviewBody: Looks like a great bag I havenâ€™t really had a chance to use it yet. I bought this to carry stuff while traveling to fishing destinations.

I fish mostly salt, Gulf of Mexico down to the Keys.  The pack is perfect for walking beaches and flats sight fishing.  The color is perfect.  Blends in with everything and does not conduct heat as much as my previous bag. I 100% reccomend this bag if you are a minimalist and fish in the extreme that require extra clothing and hydration.  Holds my H2O rain gear, GPS two 6x4 fly boxes and extra reel, leaders and first aide.  The only improvement I would make is to add an adjustment to the top of the shoulder strap so you can adjust exactly where the tool and fly patch go on your chest, but more importantly have the ability to dial in where the second wrap around strap comes around under your arm.  I am a big guy and the straps are more than long enough, just wish I could get it to connect a couple inches low.  Not a game changer, still comfortable, but it could be improve.
review.name: Fish year round.  Bag is high qaulity and rugged  100%  Reccomend

review.reviewBody: NOT completely waterproof.  The top pocket will let in water if it gets wet. I use this in the surf and a hit from a wave guarantees water in the top compartment.  I contacted customer service and they thanked me for letting them know..
review.name: Not  Completely Waterproof

name: Dry Creek Z 12L Sling

review.reviewBody: Second one of these Iâ€™ve owned. Itâ€™s a well thought out rain jacket thatâ€™s solid yet not heavy or bulky. I got many years out of the first one and expect the same for this.
review.name: Well thought out with solid construction.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This is my favorite rain coat/cold weather wind breaker for bike riding.I have used one for years and just had to replace mine. I would give it a 5 but they no longer have any bright high visibility colors. Love the zipper pits, Velcro wrists and the storable hood.
review.name: Bring back the bright colors

review.reviewBody: Nice jacket.  Very light weight.
review.name: Marmot rain jacket

review.reviewBody: I find the Precip to be a great super light, multi use shell. It stows so small there is no reason not to take it. Youâ€™re ready for sun wind or rain. It ventilates well, closes up tight, not too noisy, and has pockets places low enough to put your hands in. I wear large shirts. The medium jacket fits perfectly over a fleece top with room move.
review.name: My favorite packable shell

review.reviewBody: I needed to replace my rain jacket that failed on a recent trip and in the style and type of jacket I wanted the colors that I wanted weâ€™re not available so I decided to look into menâ€™s rain jackets and went with the bright green. I am 5â€™3 right around 150 pounds and I am not small up top but Iâ€™ll spare some dudes that the full deets that might be reading thisâ€¦ Since Iâ€™m short, Iâ€™m mindful of sleeve length for sure so with the small I was hoping that I can get it zipped up and it is just fineâ€¦ For a womenâ€™s rain jacket I likely wouldâ€™ve got a medium or potentially a large based on reviews, but the menâ€™s small seems to fit well with room for some layering like maybe a mid weight type of base. I do like all of the features on it, including the hood and the pit zips and the pockets. Itâ€™s working great and I definitely trust this brand just a heads up if thereâ€™s any other ladies considering a menâ€™s because you like the colors better!
review.name: Woman reviewing this menâ€™s rain, jacket

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Bought two of these - bright one for the trail and navy one for office. Looks good and gets job done. Kept dry, light, easily packable, and a great outer layer if mid layers are sufficient. Had a base layer, a hoodie, a light puffer, and then this jacket as outer layer and it worked perfectly. Re-affirmed my preference for this brand over others.
review.name: Great for Mountains and office

review.reviewBody: I wanted an affordable rain jacket that wasnâ€™t made with PFAS. I also bought this one because it has long sleeves; I am 6â€™1â€ and they were the perfect length. Itâ€™s light and breathable. It doesnâ€™t rub again your chin like other rain jackets with high, stiff collars. Yes, itâ€™s a little bit crinkly when you move but not terrible. If you want a super quiet jacket, donâ€™t buy this one. Overall, happy with this purchase.
review.name: Simple, breathable, not toxic

review.reviewBody: Good jacket for every day use. I'm on my third one!
review.name: Good Jacket

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Very attractive, great color and fit. Repels rain well and is breathable.
review.name: Love the jacket!

review.reviewBody: I am 6â€™1 and 190 lbs. The Medium fits me great. Material feels high quality. Iâ€™m had originally purchased the large, but it was too big.
review.name: Fits perfectly!

review.reviewBody: This stroller is the absolute best for running, jogging and for very rocky, snowy terrain. Highly recommend if you live in the woods like me. It is also great for strolls in town. It is quite hefty so I am hesitant to travel with it, but it is so great at home. Must buy the snack trays!
review.name: Best Running Stroller

review.reviewBody: Very happy with this so far. I wish it had some sort of water bottle holder though.
review.name: Super smooth ride

review.reviewBody: Love this stroller. It navigates great on the trail systems. The kids are cozy in it. I have one more on the way, so it is perfect.
review.name: Baby Stroller for two

review.reviewBody: Good but very big and heavy to be used in daily basis, also doesnâ€™t fit car back
review.name: Tooo big

review.reviewBody: Bought this for my twin granddaughters. We look forward to years of enjoyable use! Great quality and versatility.
review.name: Baby buggy

review.reviewBody: Very well made and durable. Its just big and heavy as you might expect
review.name: Quality Strollwr

review.reviewBody: I bought this stroller a month ago and we love it so far.  Super smooth ride even on a rough trail especially when compared to our Nuna.  The one downside is that it is bulky.
review.name: Smooth Ride

review.reviewBody: Very cheap stroller. the material of the seat rip very easy it is not a good design when it comes to applying the individual shade covers as well as the tire lock in the front it is not covered or guarded by anything so the kids feet constantly hit it. My kids are not big so I know it will continue to be an issue as they get older the stroller is hard to steer cause the suspension is so soft so you have to use a lot of force around turns. The stroller is to expensive to have so many issues. I do not recommend for the price.
review.name: Not worth the money

review.reviewBody:
I have 2 boys aged 1 & 3. I have been eyeing this stroller since finding out I was pregnant with my second, but keep holding off because of the price tag. I finally decided to splurge and I have been so incredibly happy with it. The errands I used to dread doing have now become enjoyable. I have started walking, hiking & jogging nearly every day as the Thule urban glide double makes it not only comfortable but genuinely easy to push around nearly 70lbs combined of toddlers! The boys absolutely love it and are always so excited to get in the stroller rain or shine. 

If you have been considering purchasing, bite the bullet and get it as this stroller is not only the best stroller you will ever find, but truly opens the door for a better life.
review.name: My only regret is not buying it sooner.

review.reviewBody: Just recently purchased this to be able to stroll around with my newborn and 17 month old, and eventually run with them. This stroller is fantastic and keeps up with the excellent quality I have come to expect with Thule. Lightweight, easy to manuever, and seamlessly goes through doorways without issues. I decided to get the newborn inlay rather than a car seat adapter so my newborn could be in it and so far its been great.
review.name: Excellent Quality

name: Chariot Urban Glide 3 Double Stroller

hasVariant.description: Buy the WANDRD Pro Camera Cube + online or shop all Travel from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Just what I wanted. Fits my bag perfectly while giving enough protection for its weight and padding. One thing: there are 2 zippers on the top section while the bottom one has only one. Zipping up in low light I have to go searching for the zipper ends and can never remember which is a double and which a single. Iâ€™m sure thereâ€™s a good technical and or manufacturing reason for this but it occurs to me that brightly colored zipper tabs would make life so much easier. Iâ€™ve done a DIY on the tabs but it feels like a small change which would add a larger perceived value.
review.name: Love it but one request.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] For the price of this cube, the process of fitting gear itâ€™s really annoying. I chose the larger int thinking Iâ€™d have more to work with but instead itâ€™s limiting. I should have gotten the half version.
review.name: Not a big fan

review.reviewBody: Bought the PRVKE 31L bag a while back and It originally came with the standard small cube. It worked well but had to carry my other big lenses and drones in separate bag. Figured it was about time to get the pro camera cube and it was definitely worth it. Itâ€™s able to hold my camera along with three of my lenses, my drone with its controller, GoPro and spare batteries for all three. A downside to this configuration though is that I still have to carry my accessories separately (GoPro mounts, chargers, filters, etc) which really isnâ€™t a big deal because I could always change what Iâ€™m carrying depending on what gear I need. I will say that the bag is heavy especially when Iâ€™m carrying it around with my 16â€ MacBook BUT it is nice to carry just about everything I need in one bag. All in all 5/5 itâ€™s exactly what i expected and needed.
review.name: Holds almost all my stuff

review.reviewBody: Unlike other camera backpacks, the Prvke series implements the use of specifically designed camera cubes. This is genius! I use the the Pro Camera Cube for my 31 L Prvke. It fits perfect, and allows me to use the entire backpack for camera and lenses. Here is the cool part...I can remove the Pro Cube and swap in the Essential Camera Cube which would give me enough room in the backpack for a couple days of clothes and still carry just the essential camera gear for the specific adventure!
review.name: This makes sense...

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This is an amazing companion to the Prvke 21L backpack . I can pack a small studio worth of equipment with this cube with space to spare. It also works great on its own if i need to really load up. Definitely grab one if you have a Prvke bag.
review.name: Must have accessory!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Quality construction, very protective of equipment.
review.name: Well-Designed

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Best camera cubes custom designed for Wandrd bags. It fits my Z8 like second skin!
review.name: One of the best camera cubes

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The camera cube fits perfectly in the pack. Dividers are designed extremely well and of good quality. Fits all of my gear like a glove. I do not worry about any damage to my camera and lenses as I have with other bags. Great product!
review.name: Camera cube feedback

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Great fit even in my 4 year old backpack. I love that I was able to expand the storage space with the pro cube to fit my lens collection as my collection grows.
review.name: Great pack expansion

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Bought this to replace the smaller cube. The pro size works perfectly! It fits my trio of lenses, 24-105, 100-500 and 15-35 and my canon r5 body, plus room for extra, like another macro lens or filters. Perfect fit in the wandrd prvke 21 liter.
review.name: A good fit

name: Pro Camera Cube +

description: Buy the Mystery Ranch High Water Flip 23L Backpack online or shop all Accessories from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: High Water Flip 23L Backpack
hasVariant.description: Buy the Mystery Ranch High Water Flip 23L Backpack online or shop all Accessories from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Well, overall, I am pretty happy with this pack. It does have some flaws. I took it on several flights, including a Hawaii dive trip, which went fantastic. Itâ€™s also been on multiple flyfishing trips on the river and at least two white water rafting trips. In a few months, Iâ€™ve had it function extremely well. However, the only big drawback I see with this is the zipper. Holding the pack itself to pull the zipper open is challenging and there should be some kind of tab or loop to hold onto on either side of the zipper. Additionally, when closing the pack, if you hold too close to the zipper and pinch around the zipper in order to hold it for closing, it sometimes wants to disengage. Overall, these are workable problems, and hopefully version two will correct them. Still a great pack.
review.name: Pretty good but zipper problems.

review.reviewBody:
I love this bag!  Its tight! Functional and nothing more. This style works!   

Its size is perfect for under the seat stow away as carry on -  bought it as my city pack for Napal. City pack and river guiding. 

Great job MR. Look forward to more water proof packs.
review.name: Bombtastic!!! Hell and High Water

review.reviewBody: Light weight but super durable. Great for in the boat on fishing trips. I also use it for a ice chest, not labeled for it but it works great to fill with ice and cold drinks.
review.name: Best dry bag I've ever purchased.

review.reviewBody:
Disclaimer: I am probably using this pack outside of its intended scope. Iâ€™m a guide in the Grand Canyon and am attempting to use this pack as a hiking daypack/daily catchall for stuff I donâ€™t want to de-rig the boat for. 

That said, first trip was pretty good! The pack is waterproof (I submerged it multiple times in slot canyons and took some huge hits in whitewater, it carried loads well, has easy carabiner loops for attaching to the boat and looks good.  

I have several recommendations. One: the zipper MUST be lubricated with tizip or 303 or both. If itâ€™s not, and exposed to water or sun, the zipper quickly becomes â€œstickyâ€ and when you pull the zip loop across, it often slides faster on one side than the other, misaligns, and therefore leaves an openingâ€¦ and defeats the entire purpose of a waterproof pack. Itâ€™s easily fixed by sliding back and forth to each zipper garage and realigning, but would be mostly prevented by silicone lubricant application. Lots of items sold with these zippers (ie soft coolers, drysuits) come with a little bottle of Tizip- would be great to see this included. 

Second- pleaaaase add a webbing anchor at each end of the zipper because the misalignment also occurs mainly because you have to grab the material of the pack to pull the zipper across (itâ€™s two handed use, definitely not one). This goes for both the main zip and the lid pocket.  

Other than that, I really love this pack so far. Lots of compliments from fellow guides too. If I continue to have zipper issues after proper zipper care then Iâ€™m afraid you guys will be getting this pack back, but hopefully this helps develop the best product! As we know there are very few high quality waterproof bags out there good enough for hard use. 

Cheers!
review.name: Initial review: 17 days in Grand Canyon

review.reviewBody:
Incredibly durable perfect everyday pack !!
Highly recommend!
review.name: Almost Bulletproof

review.reviewBody: Bought for motorcycle riding in wet weather. Works great, kept my laptop and clothes dry through rain showers. Would definitely buy again!
review.name: Great rucksack!

hasVariant.description: Buy the Mountain Hardwear Boundary Ridge GORE-TEX Glove - Men's online or shop all Accessories from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Very high-quality materials along with a very high-quality build
review.name: Nicest glove Iâ€™ve had for a while

review.reviewBody: I have searched a long time for a high quality waterproof glove. As a ski instructor I am often out in bad weather, unfortunately that includes cold rainy days. These gloves survived a recent deluge remaining warm and dry. I was thoroughly impressed. They are worth the money.
review.name: Great waterproof gloves!

review.reviewBody: They look good, but really stiff and run small.  Had to return them...awaiting on the credit ( which is taking a while).  Stay tuned.
review.name: Boundary Gloves

review.reviewBody: These gloves replaced a very similar pair of Mountain Hardware gloves that were probably over than 10 years old. I replaced with the same size.  At first, they seemed to tight, but after a couple of days of skiing, they are the right fit.  I like the included leashes and the webbing that you pull on to pull the gloves on. Very happy with the purchase.
review.name: Replaced old pair of Mountain Hardware Gloves and they are just as good

review.reviewBody: I got these as a Christmas present and was very excited about them. I have previously used MH gloves and was expecting a similar experience. Not so. I ski frequently and have used these gloves exclusively since Dec 25. There is just no way to get the fingers to assume a natural grip position easily. And the size runs small on the hand but the fingers are over long. I note that almost every review says the same about finger stiffness. Suggest you pass on these. Try them on first at least and know the stiffness doesn't go away.
review.name: Fingers difficult to flex

review.reviewBody: Very quality made gloves. They kept me dry and warm during snowsports. My fingers were a bit cold below 20Â°F, but I have cold fingers and they performed good enough compared to my other gloves.
review.name: Waterproof and warm

review.reviewBody: I climbed Chimborazo 6268 meters of altitude using these gloves and they were perfect, very hot, comfortable and useful in any type of terrain, from glacier trekking to mixed climbing at low temperatures
review.name: Perfect, warm and comfortable

review.reviewBody: This is an excellent glove for cold weather but it runs SMALL. I ordered an XL because I like extra room in my cold weather gloves in case I use liners a and it is a tight fit without a liner. If they donâ€™t loosen up I will need to send them back.
review.name: Good glove but runs small

review.reviewBody: Very nice quality. A little tight in the fingers but they havenâ€™t finished breaking in yet. Should last forever
review.name: Boundary Ridge glove.

review.reviewBody: MH's description of the glove is accurate.  It is a thick and rigid glove that will keep you warm and dry.  High quality stitching and materials.  I only wish it was more flexible.  Gripping ski poles are a bit difficult.  I hope with repetitive use they will break in. Overall, yes they are pricey but you get what you pay for.
review.name: $$$$$ but worth the money!!!

name: Boundary Ridge GORE-TEX Glove - Men's

description: Buy the Norrona Lyngen 40L Pack online or shop all Ski from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Lyngen 40L Pack
hasVariant.description: Buy the Norrona Lyngen 40L Pack online or shop all Ski from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
I ski aggressively so I demand a pack that sits tight.  I was a little skeptical with the "open back" mesh design, which creates a gap between the frame and the pack itself.  I understood how it would prevent "back sweat" but would it cause the load to bounce or sway?  

The answer was no!  The mesh design keeps me cool, it sits comfortably snug, but most important it remains just as tight as a traditional design.  Added benefit is the gap prevents any sort of lumps from uneven packing from resting uncomfortably against your back.  A great innovation, executed well.  

The large zipper pulls are easy to use with a gloved hand.  Dedicated pocket for safety gear, and plenty of options for storing skis/ice axe/etc.  

Recommended.
review.name: Great Pack, Better Innovation

name: Lyngen 40L Pack

review.reviewBody: Works great in moderate to heavy rain. Love the pink color, awesome rain shell
review.name: my new favorite rain jacket

review.reviewBody: This the lightest rain jacket Iâ€™ve ever owned but it still holds up really well to the Pacific Northwest winter. The hood works well with my helmet but when Iâ€™m not wearing a helmet, it cinches in the back so it stays on better. I got a size large so it could fit over all my layers and it fits well without being too oversized.
review.name: So light!

review.reviewBody: The jacket fits nicely, packs down to a decent size (small enough to put in a hydration vest back pocket), and is super waterproof. The rain beads up on the shell and can be shaken off easily. Iâ€™m 5â€™7â€, 140lbs, athletic build, and small chested, and the small was a good fit even over a base layer. I took away one star due to the hood. There are side elastics inside the hood along the face that you can use to pull it tighter for more fit, but no way to secure them. Also, there is no back adjustment on the hood, which would have made the hood fit perfect. I bought this jacket on sale, so will keep it, but it would have gone back if I had paid full price!
review.name: Good fit and waterproofing

review.reviewBody: Bought this jacket as my old one was getting worn out, and am very satisfied. Didnâ€™t realize how heavy and stiff my old one was till I started wearing this one- wishing I upgraded sooner!
review.name: Light, breathable, comfortable

review.reviewBody: Super light weight, packs down teeny tiny, fits perfect and honestly holds up better than most of the technical rain shells Iâ€™ve had over the years. Might get another in a different colorðŸ˜Ž
review.name: Great rain shell

review.reviewBody:
I recently purchased the Womenâ€™s Stormline Stretch Rain Shell just five days before a mountain top hike, and Iâ€™m thrilled to report it arrived right on time! On hike day, the weather was nothing short of a tempestâ€”rain, sleet, and winds greeted us at the peak.

I was truly impressed by how well the shell performed. It kept me completely dry and comfortable despite the less desirable conditions. The fabric allowed for easy movement.

For sizing, I usually go for a medium, but I opted for a large to accommodate layering. This was the right choice; the large fit perfectly without feeling bulky, while a medium would have been uncomfortably tight.

Another highlight is how compact the jacket is when packed awayâ€”it fits nicely in my bag,
review.name: Weather Warrior

review.reviewBody: Love this jacket - lightweight & packs up small. (5â€™2â€ size small fits true to size with just enough room for layers underneath without being bulky)
review.name: Great fit.

review.reviewBody: I am super impressed with how lightweight but also extremely protective this rain shell is. The design is unmatched- it has everything you need and nothing more. I ordered the XS and I am 5'0" and 110lbs, and it fits great, albeit a little long in the arms (I am just short). It's also super stretchy so when I tried it with all my base layers and midlayers on, I still has good range of motion. Can't wait to take it to the mountains and put it to the real test.
review.name: Awesome performance fit

review.reviewBody: This jacket was so much better than I had hoped for. I got a size medium to be able to fit a puffy under it. It is very roomy and comfy!
review.name: This jacket was so much

review.reviewBody: Best rain coat Iâ€™ve ever purchased. Durable and comfortable and packs down nicely for travel.
review.name: Killer Rain Coat
